sub_title: Advisor International Deployments, Unit European Cooperation and Projects, at Ministerie van Justitie en Veiligheid
summary: With a background in international and European law, human rights law, cultural anthropology and development, I am looking for a new challenge. Being both a generalist and a specialist, I would like to combine my legal and anthropological backgrounds in a challenging policy advisor or advocacy role in an international environment.

profile_positions.company: Nederlands Juristen Comité voor de Mensenrechten (NJCM)
profile_positions.description:
As a member of the Working Group European Law at the Dutch Section of the International Committee of Human Rights Jurists, I research topical human rights issues, both on the national and EU level. The Working Group meets on a monthly basis, and its members research and write about pending human rights cases and legislation.
I contribute to articles and reports, and I also organise seminars and webinars.  I have recently contributed to the stakeholder consultation for the European Commission's Rule of Law report. Currently, I am in the process of organizing a seminar on the acceptance of refugee children, and I am involved in projects regarding institutional racism, and the Article 7 TEU procedure to tackle the destruction of the rule of law in Poland and Hungary.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Working Group European Law at the Netherlands Committee of Jurists for Human Rights

profile_positions.description: The Media Foundation for West Africa (MFWA) is a regional independent non-governmental organisation recognised by the United Nations, with a network of national partner organisations in all 16 countries in West Africa. It is the biggest and most influential media development and freedom of expression organisation in the region with UN ECOSOC (Economic and Social Council) Consultative Status and Observer Status with the African Commission of Human and Peoples Rights (ACHPR). The MFWA aims at promoting and defending the right to freedom of expression of all persons particularly the media and human rights defenders in West Africa. I tracked human rights violations, in particular those with regard to the freedom of expression, and I worked on the contribution of the MFWA to the Universal Periodic Review (UPR) of the United Nations, which reviews the state of human rights protection in countries on a 5-year basis.
profile_positions.title: Researcher on the Freedom of Expression and Democracy in West Africa

profile_positions.description: Dynamiet Nederland is a specialist in removing negative BKR-registrations. BKR stands for Bureau Krediet Registratie, a database in which credits in the form of money loans are registered. A negative BKR registration occurs when someone fails to meet their payment obligations for a certain period of time. After fixing the payment arrears or paying off the loan, the registration is marked by an end date. However, the (negative) registration then remains visible for another five years, which means that people with a negative BKR registration from the past often cannot take out a new (mortgage) loan. On behalf of our clients, we request credit companies to remove a negative BKR-registration on the basis of formal grounds or a balancing of interests.
profile_positions.title: Jurist

profile_positions.description:
Nuffic is the organization for the internationalization of education in the Netherlands, carrying out several activities, some of which assigned by the Ministry of Education, Culture and Science, and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. 
In April 2018, I began at Nuffic as a legal assistant for the department NESO Facilitation and Coordination. Shortly after the start of my employment at Nuffic, I also started working for the department Legal & Administrative Affairs & Procurement, thus working for two departments, both as a legal assistant. As from June 2018, I am working merely for Legal Affairs. 
My activities for the department of Legal & Administrative Affairs & Procurement mainly relate to privacy and data protection law, in the context of which I provide legal advice within Nuffic so as to ensure that Nuffic complies with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). I will also take on other legal areas such as administrative law, international contract law and European tenders.
profile_positions.title: Jurist - Team Legal & Administrative Affairs & Procurement

profile_positions.description:
Nuffic is the organization for the internationalization of education in the Netherlands, carrying out several activities, some of which assigned by the Ministry of Education, Culture and Science, and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. 
As legal assistant, I worked for the department NESO Coordination & Facilitation. Nuffic has eleven NESO offices located outside the European Union, such as in Indonesia, South Africa and Russia. As from 25 May 2018, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) has taken effect. Although the GDPR initially only applies to corporations and organizations within the European Union, the NESO offices also fall under the scope of the GDPR, since they process some personal data of EU citizens. I was assigned with the task to ensure compliance by the NESO office with the GDPR, by analyzing, in light of the GDPR, which personal data are processed, for which purposes, and how these data are secured. On the basis of this analysis, I provided legal advice as well as ongoing legal support in the process of becoming compliant.
profile_positions.title: Jurist - Team NESO Facilitation & Coordination

profile_positions.description: In the context of the integration process of refugees, I support and supervise a client in obtaining her learning objectives for about 3 hours a week.
profile_positions.title: Language and Integration Coach

profile_positions.description: As a customer contact specialist at Aegon on the Bank and Pension Department, I clarified issues relating to bank accounts and retirement. I examined the options open to people regarding money transfers and the planning of retirement and pension payout, as well as the opportunity of requesting (international) value transfers.
profile_positions.title: Specialist Bank and Pension Department

profile_positions.description: As a volunteer I participate in various activities on a flexible basis. The Hague Cares organizes events and activities with immigrants, elderly people, mentally challenged people and children. Activities include language support for immigrants, cooking with mentally challenged people, game evenings or museum visits with elderly people and homework support for children. Occasionally, The Hague Cares organizes events with other institutions such as Pro Demos regarding the political landscape in the Netherlands and democracy.
profile_positions.title: Volunteer at The Hague Cares

profile_positions.description:
Buma/Stemra is a collective management organization protecting the intellectual property rights of composers, lyricists and publishers. I worked for the Public Affairs department, which ensures the interest of the whole organization and our stakeholders in the political arenas, operating at local, national and international level and monitoring relevant legislation and political processes.
My tasks included: Informing Members of Parliament on copyright-related topics; Attending debates in Parliament; Presenting; Cooperating with our external bureau in Brussels (Eamonn Bates Europe Public Affairs); Conducting research on the reform of copyright law in the EU as well as research on cooperation initiatives for multi-territorial licensing in view of the EU Directive on Collective Rights Management.
profile_positions.title: Intern Public Affairs

profile_positions.description: As an intern for the Netherlands, I tracked EU directives in the Netherlands and conducted legal research relating to the means and status of implementation. My responsibilities included contacting the Dutch authorities (Parliament, Ministries etc.), reading legal documents in Dutch and producing reports on the implementation of the directives in English.
profile_positions.title: Legal Intern for the NL, tracking the implementation of EU Directives in the Dutch legal system

volunteer_experiences.description: As a language- and integration coach as part of Refugee Work for the province of South Holland (Vluchtelingenwerk Zuid-Holland Noord), I helped out a women from Eritrea during her integration course. Activities were aimed at reading, writing, listening and speaking of the Dutch language, as well as knowledge of Dutch society and culture. Important personal characteristics needed were flexibility and openmindedness.

As a volunteer for The Hague Cares, I carried out various activities such as teaching Dutch to migrants at a Mosque, cooking for homeless people, taking elderly for a walk, as well as activities with mentally disabled people and children.
Preparing a diet-adjusted meal for and with kidney disease patients for the Dutch Kidney Foundation.
